meanings.definition: To surpass or outdo someone or something.
meanings.sent1: In the race, Sarah was trumping all her competitors with her speed.
meanings.sent2: John was trumping his previous high score in the game.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was trumping the other animals in the forest with its acrobatic skills.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for learning was trumping any obstacles in her way.
meanings.sent5: The sun was trumping the clouds, shining brightly in the sky.

meanings.definition: To play a trump card in a card game.
meanings.sent1: During the game, she was trumping with her ace card.
meanings.sent2: He decided to trump with his best card to win the round.
meanings.sent3: The player surprised everyone by trumping with a rare card.
meanings.sent4: She strategically trumped at the right moment, securing her victory.
meanings.sent5: His decision to trump with the wild card caught his opponents off guard.

meanings.sent1: The trumping of the elephant could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent2: The sudden trumping startled the birds in the trees.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected trumping of the drum disrupted the silence of the night.
meanings.sent4: The trumping of the thunder echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The trumping of the horn signaled the start of the race.
